items.input: Firm: NexPhase Capital, Company: Behavior Frontiers

conversationHistory.content:
For the given portfolio company, find its headquarters location. Use the PE firm name as context to help identify the correct company. Use perplexity_search or research_legal_entity to find city and state of headquarters, complete address if possible, and verify this is the main operational headquarters. Include the PE firm context in your searches to ensure accuracy. Return results as JSON: {"company_name": "Company Name", "firm_name": "PE Firm Name", "headquarters_location": {"city": "City Name", "state": "State", "full_address": "Complete address if found", "research_confidence": "high/medium/low"}}. Include only the formatted JSON in your response, exclude any other text or comments.

Inputs:
input: Firm: NexPhase Capital, Company: Behavior Frontiers

content.text: Let me search for information about Behavior Frontiers' headquarters, using NexPhase Capital as context.

input.query: Behavior Frontiers headquarters location NexPhase Capital portfolio company

content.content:
{
  "content": [
    {
      "type": "text",
      "text": "Behavior Frontiers’ headquarters is located at 100 N Pacific Coast Highway, Suite 1400, El Segundo, CA 90245.[3]

- The company’s official Contact page lists this exact **headquarters** address and phone number (888-922-2843).[3]
- Additional pages on the company’s site (e.g., employment information) confirm the same El Segundo headquarters address.[5]
- NexPhase Capital announced its acquisition of Behavior Frontiers on May 5, 2025; coverage describes Behavior Frontiers as Los Angeles-based, consistent with an El Segundo headquarters within Los Angeles County.[2][4]

Sources:
1. https://highperformr.ai/company/behavior-frontiers
2. https://www.prnewswire.com/news-releases/nexphase-announces-acquisition-of-behavior-frontiers-302445786.html
3. https://www.behaviorfrontiers.com/contact
4. https://www.beckersbehavioralhealth.com/behavioral-health-capital-investment/aba-clinic-chain-changes-hands/
5. https://www.behaviorfrontiers.com/employment-interest-form


(Results from Perplexity sonar-pro)"
    }
  ],
  "isError": false
}

content.text: Let me search for information about Behavior Frontiers and its relationship with NexPhase Capital.

input.query: Behavior Frontiers NexPhase Capital portfolio company investment acquisition current status

content.content:
{
  "content": [
    {
      "type": "text",
      "text": "Behavior Frontiers is now a NexPhase Capital portfolio company; NexPhase announced and closed its acquisition of the autism therapy provider on May 5, 2025, with terms undisclosed[5][3][1].

Key details
- Buyer: **NexPhase Capital (NPC)**, a lower middle‑market PE firm, acquired Behavior Frontiers to support expansion with the existing leadership team[5].  
- Target: **Behavior Frontiers**, founded in 2004 by CEO Helen Mader, provides ABA therapy via 26 centers plus home‑based services across 12 U.S. states and uses its proprietary PrioraCare software[5][1].  
- Deal status: Publicly announced and completed on May 5, 2025; financial terms were not disclosed[5][3].  
- Prior sponsor: **Lorient Capital** previously backed Behavior Frontiers; reporting notes it is unclear whether Lorient retains any stake post‑transaction[1].  
- Advisors/notes: Livingstone Partners advised NexPhase; their deal note (dated April 30, 2025) confirms the acquisition without disclosed terms[4].  

Official statements
- NexPhase: Framed the deal as partnering with the existing team to expand access and growth in existing and new markets[5].  
- Behavior Frontiers: Announced a “successful sale to NexPhase Capital” and highlighted growth under Lorient (clients ~900 to 2,850; employees ~1,300 to >3,300 in under five years)[3].  

Interpretation
- “Current status”: As of August 2025, Behavior Frontiers is a **portfolio company of NexPhase Capital** following the May 2025 acquisition; leadership continuity and growth focus were emphasized, while ownership percentage and valuation were not disclosed[5][3][1].

Sources:
1. https://bhbusiness.com/2025/05/05/national-autism-therapy-provider-behavior-frontiers-sells-to-nexphase-capital/
2. https://www.jdsupra.com/legalnews/healthcare-life-sciences-private-equity-6786343/
3. https://www.prnewswire.com/news-releases/behavior-frontiers-announces-sale-to-nexphase-capital-302445660.html
4. https://livingstonepartners.com/en-us/transactions/livingstone-advises-nexphase-on-the-acquisition-of-behavior-frontiers
5. https://www.prnewswire.com/news-releases/nexphase-announces-acquisition-of-behavior-frontiers-302445786.html


(Results from Perplexity sonar-pro)"
    }
  ],
  "isError": false
}

Inputs:
input: Firm: NexPhase Capital, Company: Empower

content.text: Let me search for headquarters information for Empower in the context of NexPhase Capital.

input.query: Empower company headquarters location NexPhase Capital portfolio company

content.content:
{
  "content": [
    {
      "type": "text",
      "text": "The NexPhase Capital portfolio company named Empower refers to **Empower Community Care**, whose headquarters are in **Atlanta, Georgia**.[4]

- NexPhase Capital announced its acquisition of Empower Community Care on July 16, 2025; the release identifies the company and transaction but does not list a street address, only the company name and context, which distinguishes it from Empower (the retirement services firm in Colorado).[4]
- Be aware there is a separate company, Empower (financial services), formerly Empower Retirement, headquartered in **Greenwood Village, Colorado**; this is not the NexPhase portfolio company.[3][1][5]

Sources:
1. https://craft.co/empower-retirement/locations
2. https://www.businesswire.com/news/home/20250716357573/en/Northlane-Capital-Partners-Announces-the-Sale-of-Empower-Community-Care
3. https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Empower_(financial_services)
4. https://www.prnewswire.com/news-releases/nexphase-acquires-empower-community-care-302506203.html
5. https://plan.empower-retirement.com/static/PlanEmpower/html/preLogin/footerlinks/sponsor-contact-us.html


(Results from Perplexity sonar-pro)"
    }
  ],
  "isError": false
}

- Third-party directories also show the same address: “3490 Piedmont Rd NE Ste 304, Atlanta, Georgia, 30305.”[1] A mental health provider listing likewise matches this address.[2]

I'll help verify if Empower Community Care is currently an active portfolio company of NexPhase Capital by searching for recent information.

input.query: Empower Community Care NexPhase Capital portfolio company investment status current

content.content:
{
  "content": [
    {
      "type": "text",
      "text": "Empower Community Care is currently a portfolio company of NexPhase Capital following NexPhase’s acquisition of the company announced on July 16, 2025.[3][1]

- Northlane Capital Partners sold Empower Community Care to NexPhase Capital; the sale was announced July 16, 2025.[1]  
- NexPhase Capital confirmed the acquisition the same day, describing Empower as a behavioral health enablement platform serving 2,000+ customers across all 50 U.S. states and 35+ countries.[3]  
- Industry coverage also reports NexPhase’s purchase of Empower and notes Northlane as the prior owner.[5]

Additional context:
- The deal terms were not disclosed.[3][5]  
- Media and advisory sources (Behavioral Health Business; TripleTree tombstone) corroborate NexPhase as the new owner/partner.[5][4]

Sources:
1. https://www.morningstar.com/news/business-wire/20250716357573/northlane-capital-partners-announces-the-sale-of-empower-community-care
2. https://bhbusiness.com/2025/07/31/carlyle-reportedly-buying-psychiatric-medical-care/
3. https://www.prnewswire.com/news-releases/nexphase-acquires-empower-community-care-302506203.html
4. https://www.triple-tree.com/experience/empower-community-care-nexphase-capital/
5. https://bhbusiness.com/2025/07/16/nexphase-buys-behavioral-health-enablement-platform-empower-community-care/


(Results from Perplexity sonar-pro)"
    }
  ],
  "isError": false
}

input.query: Empower Community Care NexPhase Capital most recent news 2023 2024

content.content:
{
  "content": [
    {
      "type": "text",
      "text": "The most recent development is that **NexPhase Capital acquired Empower Community Care** on July 16, 2025; terms were not disclosed, and the sale was announced by prior owner Northlane Capital Partners the same day.[5][2]

Essential context:
- The acquisition is positioned to accelerate adoption of Empower’s evidence-based programs and international expansion, per NexPhase’s announcement.[5]
- Northlane Capital Partners stated it sold Empower to NexPhase after backing Empower since 2021; NCP highlighted Empower’s growth via service line expansion, acquisitions, and key hires during its ownership.[2][4]
- Coverage in the behavioral health trade press characterized Empower as a behavioral health enablement platform serving over 2,000 customers in the U.S. and 35+ countries, with 120+ employees, providing training, clinical services, and software to public and private agencies.[3]

About 2023–2024:
- Publicly available coverage linking Empower Community Care and NexPhase Capital in 2023–2024 is not evident in the cited sources; the first clear, dated linkage is the July 16, 2025 acquisition announcement.[5][2]
- If you’re looking for Empower-related milestones under Northlane’s ownership in 2023–2024 (e.g., acquisitions, product expansions, leadership moves), those are referenced generally by NCP but not detailed in the announcements above; more granular 2023–2024 items would require additional, targeted searches of Empower’s press releases or trade coverage from those years.[2][4]

Sources:
1. https://app.fundz.net/acquisitions/acquires-6cee
2. https://www.businesswire.com/news/home/20250716357573/en/Northlane-Capital-Partners-Announces-the-Sale-of-Empower-Community-Care
3. https://bhbusiness.com/2025/07/16/nexphase-buys-behavioral-health-enablement-platform-empower-community-care/
4. https://www.morningstar.com/news/business-wire/20250716357573/northlane-capital-partners-announces-the-sale-of-empower-community-care
5. https://www.prnewswire.com/news-releases/nexphase-acquires-empower-community-care-302506203.html


(Results from Perplexity sonar-pro)"
    }
  ],
  "isError": false
}

content.text: I'll help verify the portfolio status using web search.

input.query: Insurance Systems Inc ISI NexPhase Capital portfolio company investment acquisition exit

content.content:
{
  "content": [
    {
      "type": "text",
      "text": "NexPhase Capital invested in Insurance Systems Inc. (ISI) on June 6, 2024; terms were not disclosed, and there has been no announced exit since the investment[1][3]. ISI is now a NexPhase portfolio company focused on P&C insurance software, and the deal was advised by Morgan Partners[1][4][5].

Key details
- Investor: **NexPhase Capital, LP (NPC)**, a private equity firm focused on healthcare, software, and consumer[1][3].  
- Portfolio company: **Insurance Systems Inc. (ISI)**, founded in 1997, Toronto-based provider of enterprise software for P&C insurers; flagship product **ISI Enterprise** supports policy administration, claims, billing, accounting, and reinsurance across the full policy lifecycle[1][3].  
- Deal date and nature: **Investment announced June 6, 2024**; financial terms undisclosed[1][3].  
- Rationale and growth plan: NexPhase said the investment will support ISI’s growth in existing markets, expansion into adjacent markets, and product enhancements for more integrations, faster implementations, and improved analytics[1][3].  
- Advisor: **Morgan Partners** advised ISI and described running a competitive process; they reiterated ISI’s cloud-based, highly configurable PAS positioning[4][5].  
- Exit status: As of the latest available updates, there is **no public announcement of an exit** from the ISI investment by NexPhase[1][2]. NexPhase’s general news page lists other acquisitions and exits but does not show an ISI exit item[2].

Context on NexPhase and deal sizing
- NexPhase targets control equity investments typically in the lower middle market; a Morgan Partners transaction note describes NexPhase’s experience with 100+ investments and typical equity checks of about $25–$150 million, though specific ISI terms were not disclosed[5].  
- ISI’s market focus is U.S., Canada, and global P&C carriers, aligning with NexPhase’s software vertical strategy[1][3].

Sources:
1. https://www.nexphase.com/nexphase-capital-announces-investment-in-insurance-systems-inc/
2. https://www.nexphase.com/news/
3. https://gowlingwlg.com/en/insights-resources/client-work/2024/nexphase-capital-announces-investment
4. https://www.morganpartners.com/transactions/
5. https://www.morganpartners.com/transaction/morgan-partners-advises-insurance-systems-inc-on-its-investment-from-nexphase-capital/


(Results from Perplexity sonar-pro)"
    }
  ],
  "isError": false
}

      "text": "NexPhase Capital acquired Tubby Todd Bath Co., a specialty baby bath and body care brand, on July 1, 2022.[1] Mergr lists Tubby Todd Bath as PE‑backed and owned by NexPhase following that transaction.[3]

Key details
- Buyer: **NexPhase Capital (NPC)**, a thematically driven private equity firm.[1]  
- Target: **Tubby Todd Bath Co.**, a consumer products company headquartered in Carlsbad, California, founded in 2014.[3]  
- Deal type/date: **Buyout (LBO)** closed **July 1, 2022**.[1]  
- Legal counsel references: Law firm bios for Stephen C. Koval (Blank Rome) and Marci G. Settle (Arnold & Porter) note representation of NexPhase in its acquisition of Tubby Todd Bath Co., corroborating the deal.[4][5]

Related NexPhase portfolio activity for context
- NexPhase announced acquisition of **Behavior Frontiers** (ABA therapy provider) on May 5, 2025, illustrating ongoing investment activity, though unrelated to Tubby Todd.[2]
